image.altText: Melbourne Vixens players celebrate winning the Super Netball grand final.

props.synopsis: After a lacklustre start to the 2025 season, the Melbourne Vixens upset minor premiers West Coast Fever in the Super Netball grand final, 59-58.

title.children: Fairytale finish for Vixens coach after mid-season resignation

image.altText: Police tape at a crime scene

props.synopsis: Police say they arrived at a Coleraine home to find an injured woman, who died at the scene.

title.children: Man charged with murder over woman's death in south-west Victoria

image.altText: A man and woman hold dogs in their arms

props.synopsis: As demand for truffle flavour grows, the industry fears most people are not getting the real deal.

title.children: Do you know what a real truffle tastes like?

image.altText: Here's Leonardo Puglisi setting up to anchor the 6 News Sunday night bulletin.

props.synopsis: Australian teenagers have grown up on YouTube and admit it can be harmful, but some say the government's blanket ban will do little to address the problems.

title.children: Growing up on YouTube, gen-Zers say the ban is a blow to their 'culture'

image.altText: Close-up of part of a grey and white air purifier.

props.synopsis: Even air purifiers with the best filters vary in how well they clear your home of smoke. Here's what to look for in a unit, and how to make the most of it.

title.children: Wood smoke can harm your health. Can an air purifier protect you?

image.altText: A woman with cropped dark curly hair stands leaning against a bright pink mural.

props.synopsis: When it comes to suicide prevention, Samantha McIntosh knows more than most, and senior lecturer Dr Anton Isaacs believes her lived experience is essential to turning the tide in Australia's mental health space.

title.children: Meet the woman pushing to turn suicide prevention on its head

image.altText: Logan Morris gestures to the crowd in celebration while teammates and opponents react behind him

props.synopsis: Brisbane underlines its premiership credentials with an impressive 27-point win over Collingwood at the MCG.

title.children: Lions make a statement with imperious MCG win over Magpies

image.altText: A turquoise and dark blue artists rendition of the path of underwater cables stretching from Tasmania to the mainland.

props.synopsis: The Tasmanian government has released a summary of the business case for Marinus Link, a second undersea electricity interconnector between Tasmania and Victoria. The summary, released a day after the deal was signed, predicts opportunities — but also comes with warnings.

title.children: Silence over Marinus Link deal defended, but it could cost Liberals government

image.altText: small needles in the skin

props.synopsis: The Health Complaints Commisioner investigates after reports two women were treated for lung damage after receiving a dry needling procedure at a regional Victorian massage clinic.

title.children: Patients treated for lung injuries after dry needling procedure

image.altText: A beach with dynamic blue waves washing against a sandbag wall, with a building on top of it.

props.synopsis: Inverloch residents on Victoria's Bass Coast believe a rock bag wall will solve their erosion problem, but a similar wall nearby has simply shifted the issue up the beach.

title.children: Coastal town hunts for a fix to erosion eating 10m of beach a year

image.altText: Boy wearing apron and cap standing outside a food truck in a school car park

props.synopsis: As school refusal numbers rise, one Victorian school has implemented a unique program to help re-engage students.

title.children: Daniel thought he'd never finish high school but flexible learning was a lifeline

image.altText: Education stock image

props.synopsis: When our parliaments, newsrooms, judicial benches and many other institutions all look a certain way, it is clear who is at the centre of Australia's monoculture.

title.children: The cracks are showing in what we tell ourselves about multiculturalism

image.altText: A close up of Jactina Allan speaking at a media event.

props.synopsis: Victorians will be able to work at least two days a week from home under the state governments new plan to develop legal protections for employees.

title.children: Victorian government to enshrine working from home rights

image.altText: A woman holding a leg of pork

props.synopsis: Victorian farmer Tammi Jonas says it has taken her several years to get the planning permits for her micro abattoir, but she is now celebrating changes that will substantially lower the red tape.

title.children: Red tape cut for farmers wanting to build small abattoirs

image.altText: An empty university lecture hall.

props.synopsis: The 74-year-old man is facing three charges after inappropriate images were allegedly displayed by accident during the lecture in Melbourne earlier this year.

title.children: Academic charged after child abuse material allegedly shown in lecture

image.altText: Two men sitting together with a photo on their lap of a third man dated circa 1875.

props.synopsis: For 150 years, the Letts family has run Donald's local newspaper, and at 95, editor Robin Letts is still leading the newsroom.

title.children: After 150 years, Australia's longest newspaper dynasty is set to change hands

image.altText: A blue hospital building.

props.synopsis: Monash Health in Melbourne's south-east has discovered black mould in an area where cancer patients are treated.

title.children: Major Melbourne hospital discovers black mould in cancer treatment area

image.altText: The exterior of Burgertory Mentone, featuring a red sign, pictured before its opening in August 2022

props.synopsis: The beleaguered former boss of the Burgertory restaurant chain transferred ownership of a burger joint to a heroin-addicted car thief amid a sell-off of now defunct businesses, despite shutting the shopfront a month earlier.

title.children: Burger chain boss sold shop to career criminal in business sell-off

image.altText: a portrait photograph of Kevin Bell wearing a suit in studio lighting

props.synopsis: A former Yoorrook justice commissioner and Victorian Aboriginal community leaders are urging the state government to make good on the "genuine promise" it made by setting up Australia's first Aboriginal-led truth-telling inquiry.

title.children: 'Urgent beyond words': Former Yoorrook commissioner speaks out since findings

image.altText: A quad bike and rider.

props.synopsis: A study of quad bike deaths on farms over the past 20 years finds rollover and crush protection is leading to fewer fatalities, especially in Victoria.

title.children: Study finds quad bike protection is saving lives

image.altText: Smiling blonde woman wears sunglasses, holds placard our job is to feed the city not supply electricity.

props.synopsis: Previously estimated to cost $3.9 billion, the Australian Energy Market Operator increased its cost estimate to $7.6 billion, and potentially as much as $11.4 billion.

title.children: VNI West transmission network costs double as farmers fight project

image.altText: A woman sits in a paddock.

props.synopsis: Called The Electric Eight, these Warrnambool mums are speaking out via a podcast about their experiences of losing a baby in the hope that other regional women and families can find better support.

title.children: The Electric Eight want to help you talk about losing a baby

image.altText: A middle-aged man and woman stand outside in front of several solar panels, smiling at the camera

props.synopsis: Victorian government regulations limit the sharing of generated power between properties, even if they have the same owner. Farmers are calling for changes so they can capitalise on their own microgrids.

title.children: Farmers call for ease of regulations to allow renewable energy microgrids

image.altText: The Coroners Court of Victoria sign in front of the Australian, Aboriginal, and Torres Strait Islander flags.

props.synopsis: A midwife says "extreme tiredness" could have impaired her decision-making during a tragic home birth in Victoria.

title.children: Midwives tell inquest of 'regrets' from home birth and baby's death

image.altText: A police car and police tape seen blocking the scene of a residential street in Wollert, where a shooting took place

props.synopsis: Police are investigating a suspected targeted shooting after the discovery of a 21-year-old's body in Wollert. Separately, detectives have charged five men with murder over a fatal shooting almost two years ago.

title.children: Gunman at large after 21-year-old found dead in Melbourne's north

image.altText: A woman smiles and poses for a photo that has been overlayed with a sepia filter, adjusting the colour to give it a yellow tone

props.synopsis: A coroner finds no clear cause of death for 53-year-old Rachael Dixon, who died at a wellness retreat in regional Victoria.

title.children: Coroner finds woman died 'in the context' of taking magic mushrooms

image.altText: A police car at night

props.synopsis: A man shot dead by police in regional Victoria was attacking his sister when officers arrived, authorities say.

title.children: Man shot dead by police was attacking his sister, authorities say

image.altText: A man wearing a chequered shirt and helmet sitting on a motorbike looking at the camera.

props.synopsis: The mother of teenage man, who died after he was hit by a car, says the bond she shared with her son was the most incredible thing she had in her entire life.

title.children: Friends, family pay tribute to beloved teen killed in crash

image.altText: A man pictured smiling at the altar on his wedding day.

props.synopsis: Father of two Brian Dean died of sepsis about 24 hours after he was discharged from a Geelong hospital. His family and their lawyer want a coroner to examine whether the death was preventable.

title.children: Brian was discharged from hospital. He died from sepsis the next day

image.altText: Rebels bikies ride their motorcycles along Scarborough Beach Road.

props.synopsis: Specialist police prepare for a Rebels Motorcycle Club run to Melbourne this weekend, before tougher laws banning the display of club colours and insignia come into force.

title.children: Rebels to ride through Victoria in last hurrah before gang colours ban

image.altText: A red and white majestic Victorian mansion with a turret, blue sky with clouds.

props.synopsis: Local government elected officials in Victoria say they are being threatened, abused and harassed online and in person, but they have no protection.

title.children: Councillors call for help as threats, abuse leave them living in fear

image.altText: A fire truck and firefighters.

props.synopsis: A man has been arrested for his alleged role in the December 2024 arson of the Adass Israel Synagogue of Melbourne in the city's inner south-east.

title.children: Overseas links probed in Melbourne synagogue arson attack as man arrested

image.altText: A house on a rural block.

props.synopsis: Convicted triple-murderer Erin Patterson has been barred from selling the home in which she served her relatives a deadly beef Wellington meal so it may be used in future compensation claims by her victims or their families.

title.children: Mushroom murderer Erin Patterson barred from selling Leongatha home

image.altText: A brick wool factory with several angled iron roof gables

props.synopsis: Victoria's last wool cleaning mill will close in Geelong next month, after a merger with the only other remaining wool scour in the country.

title.children: Wool scouring to end in Victoria after more than 160 years
